title: Steamed Fish with Ginger-Scallion
description: Tender white fish fillets are gently steamed and finished with an aromatic hot oil infused ginger-scallion sauce. Bright, savory, and clean-flavored — this quick method preserves delicate texture and showcases ginger and scallion freshness.

ingredients.notes: peeled and cut into thin matchsticks
white and green parts separated (reserve whites for steaming under fish if desired)
about 3 tbsp, for hot oil finish
about 1 tsp, toasted sesame oil for flavor
enough to create steam in wok/steamer
optional, for garnish or slight heat

steps.text: Prepare fish: pat fillets dry and season both sides lightly with salt. Arrange fillets in a single layer on a heatproof shallow plate that fits your steamer, leaving small gaps between pieces.

Prepare aromatics: place half the julienned ginger under and around the fillets for gentle infusion and scatter the white parts of scallions under the fish if using; reserve green scallion tops and remaining ginger for sauce.
Set up steamer: bring water to a vigorous simmer in a wok or large pot with a steamer rack or bamboo steamer; water level should not touch the plate when inserted.

Steam fish: place the plate with fish into the steamer, cover, and steam until just cooked through and opaque in the center (test thickest part), about 6–7 minutes for 150 g fillets; adjust time for thinner or thicker pieces.
While fish steams, make sauce: combine light soy sauce and sugar in a small heatproof bowl placed near the stove. Add the reserved julienned ginger and scallion greens to the bowl.

Heat oil: in a small saucepan or skillet, heat the vegetable oil until shimmering and just smoking; remove from heat and carefully pour the hot oil over the ginger and scallion mixture to release aroma. Stir in sesame oil and taste, adjust salt if needed.

Finish and serve: remove steamed fish from steamer, pour sauce evenly over the hot fish so flavors permeate, garnish with cilantro and sliced red chili if using, and serve immediately with lemon/lime wedges on the side.
